page.title: 06Bratton Fleming
page.content: Population 663 in 1981 census The village is on the edge of Exmoor. Essentially it is a dormitory village for Barnstaple.Most people travel there for shopping,work and recreation. The village hall is currently undergoing exstensive alteration costing in the region of Â£10 000.The hall is used by various groups, over 60's,country dance,flower arranging, playgroup,toddler group.It is also used for dances,bingo,whist drives etc. Once a year on the last Saturday in May and for two days preceding it the village holds a Festival.This year there was an art exhibition,school concert,a procession of floats,side shows and sports.The festival ends with a dance.This year about Â£450 was raised for local charities.
